Yup, Skidrow update 4-6 is currently broken. It downloads and installs fine, but it always insta-crashes on startup (you get to the second intro video, then a critical error pops up).

Someone from the skidrow update 4-6 forum found a workaround. He backed up the following: sots2_managed.dll and mars exe from the bin dir(x64) and the Mis_Missile.weapon from the assets/base/weapons.(those are after update 3)
Then installed update 4-6 and overwrited those files. In my case the game starts and i didn't have any crashes so far (played only 50-60 turns). The stupid AI combat turn remains despite the fact they said it's fixed, but i noticed some changes in starbase module interface. I guess some of the changes are made, but i didn't have the opportunity to test if combat is fixed(alot of bugs there to fix)

Well, the "workaround" is basically to remove several of the things the patch is supposed to fix, as you just overwrite "fixed" data with the old broken one. That's why for example the AI turns are still crappy that way. SotS2 will need a lot of patches before I'll play it seriously, I'll just stick with SotS Prime ACM for now.
